headline.main: Massachusetts Appoints Official and Hires Firm to Fix Exchange Problems

docs.abstract: Gov. Deval Patrick of Massachusetts has appointed an insurance executive to oversee the state’s bungled effort to comply with President Obama’s health care law. The state will also pay a technology firm to help.
docs.snippet: Gov. Deval Patrick of Massachusetts has appointed an insurance executive to oversee the state’s bungled effort to comply with President Obama’s health care law. The state will also pay a technology firm to help.

docs.lead_paragraph: Florida's own health insurance marketplace, long touted by Republican lawmakers as a free-market solution to providing affordable health coverage, is expected to launch as early as next week.

headline.main: Florida Set to Launch Its Owns Limited Insurance Marketplace
headline.print_headline: Florida Set to Launch Its Owns Limited Insurance Marketplace

docs.snippet: Florida's own health insurance marketplace, long touted by Republican lawmakers as a free-market solution to providing affordable health coverage, is expected to launch as early as next week.

docs.lead_paragraph: A wrinkle in the HealthCare.gov website that temporarily left some children without insurance coverage has been fixed, federal officials said Friday.

headline.main: Feds Say They Fixed Medicaid Problem for Children
headline.print_headline: Feds Say They Fixed Medicaid Problem for Children

docs.snippet: A wrinkle in the HealthCare.gov website that temporarily left some children without insurance coverage has been fixed, federal officials said Friday.

headline.main: A Policy Response to Job Market Weakness

docs.abstract: Even if the recent deceleration in job growth is temporary, congressional action — an unlikely prospect — could foster job creation and help the long-term unemployed, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: Even if the recent deceleration in job growth is temporary, congressional action — an unlikely prospect — could foster job creation and help the long-term unemployed, an economist writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. Chamber of Commerce on Friday called on the government to ratchet up pressure on India over intellectual property rights, in a move that could help prevent Indian companies from producing cheap generic versions of medicines still under patent protection.

headline.main: Trade Group Seeks More U.S. Pressure on India Over Patent Protection

docs.lead_paragraph: Swiss voters are being asked to decide on a proposal to cap immigration to the Alpine republic, a long-standing demand of the country's most powerful party.

headline.main: Swiss to Vote on Plan to Limit Immigration
headline.print_headline: Swiss to Vote on Plan to Limit Immigration

docs.snippet: Swiss voters are being asked to decide on a proposal to cap immigration to the Alpine republic, a long-standing demand of the country's most powerful party.

headline.main: A Hotelier Corrects His Testimony on the Impact of the Affordable Care Act

docs.abstract: In his initial testimony, Peter Anastos said that his company would make sure that its new hires worked fewer than 30 hours a week so that they would not qualify for health insurance.
docs.snippet: In his initial testimony, Peter Anastos said that his company would make sure that its new hires worked fewer than 30 hours a week so that they would not qualify for health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. debt limit suddenly looks a lot less threatening as Republicans in the House of Representatives struggle to choose from a diminishing list of minor conditions for an increase needed by the end of this month.

headline.main: U.S. Debt Limit Gathers Rust as Political Budget Leverage Tool
headline.print_headline: U.S. Debt Limit Gathers Rust as Political Budget Leverage Tool

docs.snippet: The U.S. debt limit suddenly looks a lot less threatening as Republicans in the House of Representatives struggle to choose from a diminishing list of minor conditions for an increase needed by the end of this month.
